text:
Meneses Monroy (full name Marco Antonio Meneses Monroy, b. 1984) is a Mexican writer, lawyer and researcher. He is mainly known for his poetry. He is the founder and director of the magazine "El Comité 1973" and member of the literary group "El Comité".
Biography.
Meneses Monroy was born in Pachuca, Hidalgo, where he lives. Hie writes in Spanish and English.
He has a Master's degree in Population Studies from the Universidad Autónoma del Estado de Hidalgo (2012) previously he had studied Laws in that institution (2009). He also studied an academic program about Intercultural competences in the Westfälische Wilhelms-Universität Münster, (Germany) (2010–2011).
In 2011 Meneses Monroy participated in an international congress about poetry. He presented a study about Alfonso Reyes. In 2012 he founded the literary magazine El Comité 1973. In 2014 Meneses published a study about the indigenous population in Mexico. In 2017 he participated in the celebration of the fifth anniversary of El Comité 1973, the event took place in the Centro Cultural del México Contemporáneo, in Mexico City. In 2018 he took part in the project Mexican poetic map.
Radio.
Meneses has been invited to various radio stations in order to talk about his work as a writer. In 2018 his poem "Acerca de la vida y la muerte" was read in the podcast "Rotterdam Chips."
